snippet: Discussions in Istanbul ended with no word of progress, but both sides said another meeting was planned.
abstract: Low-level talks between Iran and the group of big powers over the disputed Iranian nuclear program end with both sides saying another meeting is planned; announcement gives no hint of progress but nonetheless suggests that neither side is ready to declare the effort a failure.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and THOMAS ERDBRINK
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Thomas Erdbrink from Tehran.

lead_paragraph: Discussions in Istanbul ended with no word of progress, but both sides said another meeting was planned.

headline.seo: Iran Nuclear Talks Are to Continue as Their Tone Heats Up
headline.main: Iran Nuclear Talks Are to Continue as Their Tone Heats Up
headline.print_headline: Iran Nuclear Talks Are to Continue as Their Tone Heats Up
